intro: Drymonia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan drymonia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces showy, five-petaled flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
